law.catch_line: Return of tax savings to customers.
law.text: To the extent that a provider experiences a tax savings as a result of the provisions of KRS 136.600 to 136.660 in the first year of tax collections under KRS 136.600 to 136.660, the savings shall be returned proportionately to all residential and business customers of the provider. The specific manner in which the savings are returned to its customers shall be at the discretion of the provider. The Office of the Attorney General is authorized to enforce the requirements of this section.
law.history: Created 2005 Ky. Acts ch. 168, sec. 108, effective January 1, 2006.
